title: RBI Grade B - QRE Practice Mock Test
instruction: In the following questions, a sentence is given which is divided into four parts. One of these parts may have a grammatical or an idiomatic error. Choose the part containing error as your answer. If there is no error in the given sentence then choose option (E) as your answer.

quiz.text: The question consists of two statements numbered "I and II" given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.There are four friends A, B, C and D. Find the age of D?Statement-I: The ratio of present ages of A to B, B to C, C to Dand D to Ais (x-4): (x - 10), (x - 10): (x + 4), (x + 4): (x +12) and 3:2 respectively.Statement-II: The ratio of present ages of A to B, B to C, C to D is (x-4): (x - 10), (x - 10): (x + 4) and (x+4): (x + 12) respectively, and average present ages of four friends is 36.5 years.
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are sufficient to answer the question.
The data in both statement I and statement II are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: If 1 is added to each even digit and 1 is subtracted from each odd digit and then how many numbers so formed will be fully divisible by 2?
options: two
one
four
none
three

quiz.text: COLUMN I (A) Gandhi’s tryst with the economics of human capital development and (B)There’s the issue whether ex gratia should have been limited to poorer citizens (C) In a country with poor public health and extremely unequal access to quality private healthcare, COLUMN II (D)Covid wasn’t the first and won’t be the last disease that can cause deaths on a large scale. (E)why someone is deserving of our anger, our aggression and why they evoke negativity within us. (F)our leaders, from the PM to the external affairs ministers, did a lot of quiet diplomacy.
options: A-F
B-E
C-D
C-E
None of these

quiz.text: A question is followed by three statements I, II, and III Read all the statements to find the answer to the given question and then answer accordingly that which statement/statements can give the answer alone/together.Three mixtures A, B, and C and each mixture consist of milk and water and these three mixtures are poured in equal quantity into a fourth empty vessel. What is the ratio of milk and water in the fourth vessel?Statement I: When 10 litres of mixture A was mixed with 12.5 litres of mixture B, the ratio of milk and water in the new mixture became 28: 17 respectively.Statement II: In the mixture C, the concentration of milk is 50% more than that of water.Statement III: When 7.5 litres of mixture B was mixed with 10 litres of mixture C, the ratio of milk to water in the new mixture became 24: 11.
options: Either I and II together or II and III together is sufficient.
Any of the two statements together are sufficient.
All the three statements together are not sufficient
All the three statements together are sufficient
None of these

quiz.text: If the sum of the first and the last digits of a number is even then change the middle digit of that number to 9 and if the sum of the first and the last digits of a number is odd then interchange the first and last digit then which of the following numbers thus formed will be second lowest?
options: 834
245
772
587
697

quiz.text: COLUMN I (A)You need to free yourself from allowing a situation or (B)Because language shapes thoughts, and for centuries, (C)The world’s most indebted property developer, COLUMN I (D)sportingly let themselves be called batsmen, (E)and in these financial tremors there’s an opportunity for India. (F) a person to trigger aspects of you that make you uneasy and feel negative.
options: A-D
B-E
C-F
A-F
None of these

quiz.text: 5A² = (4B)² = C²/2Quantity I: A² - B² + C² - AB x √5Quantity II: A² + B² - C² - 3BC x √2Quantity III: B² - A² + C² - 4AC x √2.50
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: Who among the following individual attends the meeting in June?
options: The one who attends immediately after David
Alex
The one who attends immediately before Henry
Chris
Frank

quiz.text: COLUMN I (A) For the service of humanity, the intellect must be liberated (B) Every person who enters your life for good or for bad, (C) Unless that is achieved, we cannot have COLUMN II (D) they are important to unlearn these ingrained biases. (E) is a guide sent to help you on a journey of growth, introspection and healing. (F) the intellect wants to make the fullest utilisation of mundane wealth
options: A-E
C-F
B-E
B-D
None of these

quiz.text: Quantity I:The roots of the equation x²– 7x + 12 = 0 are p and q. What is the sum of all possible values of (p)q?Quantity II:The first and last term of an A.P. is 320 and –160 respectively and the common difference can be –160 or –120. If the number of terms can be a or b, what is the sum of all possible values of (a³-b²)?Quantity III:Roots of the equation x³-14x²+ 35x – 22 = 0 are e, f and g, (where e < f < g). What is the value of (e + g)f?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: Four of the following five are alike in a certain way. Who among the following does not belong to the group?
options: Ben
Chris
Grace
Emma
David

quiz.text: COLUMN I (A) It’s so easy to slip down a well-oiled path, (B) A Rs 50,000 payout for a daily wager’s family can make a real difference, (C)Our political leaders, too, understood that they needed to pitch in COLUMN II (D) but it’s liberating to break shackles of conformity and to march to the beat of your own drummer. (E) that played a crucial but not very visible (F) made us realise that we had to raise our game to stay in the contest.
options: A-D
B-D
C-F
A-E
None of these

quiz.text: The question consists of two statements numbered “I and II” given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.A boat can travel a distance of 576 km in upstream as well as in downstream in a total of 30 hours. Find the total time taken by the boat to cover 400 km in upstream and 408 km in downstream.Statement I: Speed of stream is 75% less than the upstream speed of the boat.Statement II: The boat can travel 450 km in downstream in 7.5 hours if the speed of stream is 20 km/h.
options: The data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question.
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I and statement II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: Statements:Some cricket is tennis.A few tennis is game.No game is badminton.Some badminton is football. Conclusions:I) Some badminton is not football is not a possibility.II) All cricket can be tennis.III) No football is tennis is a possibility.
options: Only conclusions II and III follow
Both conclusions I and III follow
None follows
Only conclusion III follows
Either conclusion I or III follows

quiz.text: COLUMN I (A) To feel the need to get close to someone and on days just be on your own (B) Many wanted the freedom to travel, to relocate geographically with ease, to have time for hobbies and (C) You are ever changing and it’s both time with and COLUMN II (D) is Sharing memes and replying to Instagram stories the new way of communicating love (E) it’s all out in the open and done through words, visual and graphics (F) to not have to base their lives on a system that consumes you as a parent.
options: A-D
B-F
C-F
C-D
None of these

quiz.text: If 60% of male in village B are above 40 age and 30% of females in village D are below 40 age, then find the difference between the number of male in village B above 40 and the number of females in village D above 40?
options: 240
244
260
280
300

quiz.text: How many words are there between “post” and “paper” in the step IV?
options: 0
3
5
2
1

quiz.text: The moment a person believes(A)/ in something absolutely, (B)/ he will inevitable be at war (C)/with someone who holds an opposing belief. (D)
options: A
B
C
D
No Error.

quiz.text: The average of females in villages B, D, E is how much percent more or less than the average of male in villages A, C and E?
options: 10.24% less
11.62% less
12.64% less
14.22% more
13.24% more

quiz.text: What is the position of “prison” in the last but one step?
options: 2nd to the right end
2nd to the left end
at the left end
4th to the right end
3rd to the left end

quiz.text: When terrible events happen, (A)/ everyone reacts in instant outrage, (B)/ but they return, in a short while(C),/ to business as usually. (D)
options: A
B
C
D
No Error.

quiz.text: If 60% of females in village E are literate and 65% of females in 5 villages are illiterate, then find the percentage of literate females in village E out of the rest villages literate female?
options: 45.87%
46.66%
47.44%
56.72%
69.90%

quiz.text: Statement: Raman decided to get the Hotel reservation in advance for the trip to Shimla in October. Assumptions: I. Hotel rates may increase next month II. There will be increase in tourists next month
options: If only assumption I is implicit
If only assumption II is implicit
If either assumption I or II is implicit
If neither assumption I nor II is implicit
If both assumptions I and II are implicit

quiz.text: It is time to celebrate(A)/ our diversity, rather than (B)/ try to convert the entire world (C)/ to our point of view.(D)
options: A
B
C
D
No Error.

quiz.text: A, B and C together can complete a piece of work together in 45 days. A and C together can complete the work in 67.5 days. B is 33.33% more efficient than A.Which of the following statements is true to the data given above?I. If B worked with 50% efficiency, A with 133.33% efficiency, and C worked with 100% more efficiency so work is completed in 33.75 days.II. If C is worked as a negative worker, work is completed in 270 days.III. If, A and C continuously working, B is working every 2nd day then work is completed in 53 days
options: I only
I and III only
I and II only
II and III only
All are true.

quiz.text: Statement: After the outbreak of a global pandemic there has been a severe economic crisis all across the globe.Conclusion:I: Many people might have lost their jobs.II: Share markets may have crashed due to a global economic crisis.
options: Only conclusion I follows
Only conclusion II follows
Either conclusion I or II follow
Both conclusions I and II follow
Neither conclusion I nor II follows

quiz.text: With unemployment a big worry (A)/ across India, the reservation and anti-reservation (B)/ protests could get louder (C)/ posed a challenge for the Centre.(D)
options: A
B
C
D
No Error.

quiz.text: A and B started a business with initial investment of Rs. 4000 and Rs. 2500 respectively. After P months A, left the business and at the end of Q years, ratio of profit share of A and B is 4:5.Find which of the following statement will satisfied the value of (P,Q) in ordered pair.I. 6 months, 1 yearII. 4 months, 2/3rd of yearIII. 5 months, 18 months
options: I only
II only
III only
I and II only
II and III only

quiz.text: Amit Patel walked 20m towards the east. Then he turned left and walked 25m. After that, he turned right and walked 30m. Then he turned left and walked 10m. Finally, he turned right and walked 20m. In which direction is he from the starting position?
options: North
South
North east
North west
East

quiz.text: Courts are said to be (A)/ duty-bound to protect the (B)/ farmers right to sell their (C)/ crops at favourable prices.(D)
options: A
B
C
D
No Error.
